title: Nami Wallet
description: Cardanoのポテンシャルを最大限に引き出すためには、直感的で使いやすく、遊び心のあるインターフェイスと、高い柔軟性を備えたウォレットが必要です。

f6_assessments.q0:
- I'm not sure if the problem stated is really a problem once we have other wallets running, however, I am sure that one of the big problems in the present – and will be in the future – is how intuitive and friendly all the tools inside the crypto world are. Since we must think in scalability, it's mandatory to work, develop and think in intuitive tools.
- The interaction between the wallet and websites is a really nice feature.
f6_assessments.q1:
- Since it's already running with 2000+ users, I think it is very doable.
- The points which I think that could be better explained are: a) budget could be broken down and better explained since the tool is already in use, e.g. why you need this much money, how are you going to use this throughout the next steps,… ; b) timetable – what should we expect to see and how long we must wait to see it; c) how do you intend to build these new features into the Nami; d) will it need more funding (is 40K is too much or too little?)
f6_assessments.q2:
- The fact that is missing a roadmap with milestones lower the possibility of auditability because I don't know what to expect in what time. Thus, this point should be improved.
- I imagine that the metrics are the number of users, however I would like to see something more detailed with parameters and, maybe, create some metrics that measure the engagement during each phase and, of course, retaining the feedback to improve the platform and help other devs.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal kind of assumes that we would download the app and use it to be able to e.g. compare this with Yoroi. In the comments section it was mentioned that originally this wallet was mentioned as "Metamask-like" way to access and use the web 3.0 sites in the Cardano ecosystem. If I am not badly mistaken, Yoroi will serve the same purpose. Therefore, it is unclear what value does this add.
f6_assessments.q1: Obviously the proposer knows what they are talking about. They have already launched an app that is being used by thousands of people. Well done! Yet the plan needs refinement.
f6_assessments.q2: It is unclear what the funding is for? Is it to cover the work done already? Or is to cover the next steps mentioned? If latter, which ones, in which priority order and how much effort does each one take? There are no KPIs mentioned either.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal extends the feature of an already working product. I believe we should have a lot of options when it comes to choosing a wallet we prefer. The planned feature sounds incredible specially having it as a full node wallet and have a support to mobile and hardware wallet.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's experience is well enough and the plans presented are achievable as it has been implemented already on other wallets. I'll rate this 5/5
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal failed to indicate how the asking fund will be utilized and a clear timeline of execution, therefore, auditability is nigh.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal extends features of an already implemented wallet. This is another great option for storing your tokens. The planned feature sound incredible especially having it as a full node wallet also supports mobile and hardware versions. The proposer has effectively addressed the challenge and continues doing additional features.
f6_assessments.q1: Very experienced team that has presented their plan in an achievable way. There is a high likelihood of success.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does include some milestones, but the size of the budget would indicate that there should be much clearer metrics that can be audited to ensure success. The biggest metric would be the number of users.

f6_assessments.q0: Nami is already being used by me on a daily basis. it currently serves as an easy gateway to the nft space and is already well established in the nft-community. Improving the basic functionality by adding smart contract functionality and most importantly hardware wallet support for additional security are fundamental to the further growth of the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The founders of nami-wallet have already proven their technical capabilities with the creation of the wallet and previous projects such as spacebudz and the Berry pool (SPO). They have also supplied a couple of updates on the Nami wallet so far. This project is everything the cardano community can hope for: an initial effort to show a minimal viable product by very well known community members followed by funding from the community to provide a safe wallet without cutting corners.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan involes continued improvements on the wallet as well as hardware-wallet support and smart contract functionality. I can understand that it is difficult to give a precise date on when what functionality will be integrated, but as per the assessment questions, this point hasn't been addressed in detail. Despite the lack of a detailed plan, I have no doubts that the funding of this project will be highly beneficial to the community and it's future growth.

f6_assessments.q0: Nami wallet does address the challenge, which goal is to build attractive application to  onboardmore users. Having a light wallet for smart contact integration is essential to adoption.
f6_assessments.q1: Alessandro has both experience and reputation within the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: Nami wallet is open source, so auditing the progress is trivial. Success will be measured also by number of downloaded Nami wallets.

solution: ブラウザベースのウォレット拡張機能を構築し、非常にダイナミックでありながら、非常にシンプルで直感的なものになっています。
experience: Nami Walletはすでに実用化されており、2000人以上のユーザーがいます。また、「SpaceBudz」を立ち上げ、「Berry Pool」の運営も行っています。
